Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
will check it now. I know what caused the issues... I saw it on AWS network, and just turned off the nodes that were doing it at the time. Was too hard to fix. 
What happens, is a split tx is created but is not mined for some reason, this then prevents the local wallet from making another split, because it thinks the utxo used to split is spent in mempool. 
But no other nodes see this tx, and it never gets mined. 
I caused the spam of spent utxo, by forgetting to stop it from checking mempool for unspents. 
The "fix" we have, doesnt actually fix the real issue, but it works around it, by making sure that all utxo selected have 5 confirms and are not spent.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Also, with utxo cache or not, this issue would have been much the same.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It seems there is maybe one minor bug with -26 errors, but it is rare, and most liekly a race condtion of some kind. Doesnt seem worth fixing at this stage. 100% perfection cannot be attained with a large distributed network, but I think I got darn close to 98% of notarizations to work.  At one time I rember it was less tahn 50% sucess rate on KMD main net... So its come a long way.

Content:
`Wasn't sure what was happening there.  Not much in the channel.` @CrisF 

@blackjok3r  and I had a good chat about BLUR and dPoW . Something Iâ€™ll be doing here very soon (probably tomorrow) Is typing up a flow diagram for code comprehension, and of the higher up stuff for the less code-savvy too. Itâ€™s been a crap ton of code, but itâ€™s very close to being fully operational. About 90% of the work done, Iâ€™d venture. Everything is integrated deeply into the Blur binaries, so adding my work to other XMR-derived chains should be relatively smooth for future

Author: Biz#0842
Content: You know how busy is, usually very quiet haha ğŸ™‚

Author: Biz#0842
Content: Because itâ€™s integrated so deeply into wallet, daemon, protocol messaging, just about everywhere, itâ€™s a lot of jumping around and requires a lot of knowledge of how the CN networks operate. So that is the purpose in the write up. Eliminating that barrier hopefully

Author: Biz#0842
Content: I think it directly touches every layer except p2p, and even that layer it uses indirectly  through the protocol relays

Author: Biz#0842
Content: Cool thing is everything will be automated, and I re-used the existing notary BTC keys as seeds for viewkey generation

Author: Biz#0842
Content: So itâ€™s really hands-off and transparent for all NN operators
